Package main.Purchaseables

Class Athlete

java.lang.Object
main.Purchaseables.Athlete
All Implemented Interfaces:
Purchasable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AllRounder, Attacker, Defender
public class Athlete extends Object implements Purchasable
The main Athlete superclass; handles variables for all stats, names, and costs, as well as provides a static method for generating new Athletes of a random specialization (subclass). Athletes may be purchased by the player from the shop and stored in their team's arrays, or generated as members of opposing teams.

  • Constructor Details

    • Athlete

      public Athlete(Random r)
      Constructor. Sets the name, costs, and basic stats of a newly generated Athlete.
      Parameters:
      r - Random number generation object.

  • Method Details

    • setDummy

      public void setDummy()
      Designates the Athlete as a "dummy" member, representative of an empty slot in team arrays. Dummies are named "Empty", have 0 Atk, 0 Def, and 1 HP. Players should not be able to interact with them, including viewing stats, buying or selling, using items on them, or participating in matches while they are on the team.

    • isDummy

      public boolean isDummy()
      Checks if the Athlete is a "dummy".
      Returns:
      'True' if Athlete is a dummy, otherwise 'false'.

    • genName

      public String genName()
      Calls static methods of NameGen to generate the Athlete a random forename and surname from the available options.
      Returns:
      String containing generated name.

    • genStat

      public int genStat()
      Returns a random number for the purpose of initial Atk/Def/HP generation. Does not apply specialization bonuses; these are handled in subclass constructors.
      Returns:
      Randomly generated int from 1-10 (inclusive).

    • genCost

      public double genCost()
      Returns a random number for the purpose of Athlete purchase cost generation. Resale costs are subsequently determined by the constructor.
      Returns:
      Randomly generated double from 50-100 (inclusive).

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Gets Athlete's name.
      Specified by:
      getName in interface Purchasable
      Returns:
      String containing Athlete's name.

    • getBuyCost

      public double getBuyCost()
      Gets the cost to buy Athlete at the shop or during initial game setup.
      Returns:
      Double representing Athlete's purchase cost.

    • getSellCost

      public double getSellCost()
      Gets the amount of money the player receives if they resell the Athlete.
      Returns:
      Double representing Athlete's resale cost.

    • getPosition

      public String getPosition(Athlete[] team, Athlete member)
      Determines the Athlete's current field position using their index in the given array. If the given Athlete is not in the Array, returns "N/A". Currently unused.
      Parameters:
      team - The array to check for position information.
      member - The Athlete to retrieve information for.
      Returns:
      String containing the given Athlete's current position, or "N/A" if they are not found in the array.

    • getInjured

      public boolean getInjured()
      Checks if the Athlete is considered "injured" (O HP). Injured Athletes may prevent a player competing in matches.
      Returns:
      Whether the Athlete is injured or not.

    • getAtk

      public int getAtk()
      Gets Athlete's Atk stat.
      Returns:
      Int representing Athlete's Atk stat.

      Sets Athlete's Atk stat to a new value.
      Parameters:
      newAtk - Int representing the Athlete's new Atk value.

    • getHP

      public String getHP()
      Gets a String readout of Athlete's HP for displaying to the player.
      Returns:
      String containing Athlete's HP in the format "current/maximum".

    • getMaxHP

      public int getMaxHP()
      Gets Athlete's maximum HP stat.
      Returns:
      Int representing Athlete's maximum HP.

    • setMaxHP

      public void setMaxHP(int newHP)
      Sets Athlete's maximum HP to a new value.
      Parameters:
      newHP - Int representing the Athlete's new maximum HP threshold.

    • getCurrentHP

      public int getCurrentHP()
      Gets Athlete's current HP stat.
      Returns:
      Int representing Athlete's current HP.

    • setCurrentHP

      public String setCurrentHP(int newHP)
      Sets Athlete's current HP to a new value. Current HP may not exceed the Athlete's maximum nor fall below 0. If the given value is higher than the Athlete's maximum HP, their current HP will instead be set to the maximum. If the value is below 0, their current HP will be set to 0, the Athlete will be designated "injured", and the player will recieve a warning message.
      Parameters:
      newHP - Int representing the Athlete's indended new HP.
      Returns:
      String describing the changes to Athlete's HP.

    • getSpecialization

      public String getSpecialization()
      Gets Athlete's specialization. Overriden by subclasses; if the Athlete is not one of the subclasses designating a specialization, "No Specialization" is provided instead.
      Returns:
      String containing "No Specialization".

    • getDescription

      public String getDescription()
      Formats a readout of the Athlete's name, specialization, and stats for display to the player through the club and shop.
      Returns:
      String containing Athlete's name, specialization, stats in a readable format.

    • getPurchaseDetails

      public String getPurchaseDetails()
      Prints the results of getDescription() followed by a similarly formatted readout of Athlete's purchase and resale costs.
      Specified by:
      getPurchaseDetails in interface Purchasable

    • buy

      public void buy(PlayerTeam player)
      Unused skeleton method to process the player's purchase of the Athlete. Withdraws funds, allows player to set the Athlete's name, and (unimplemented) adds them to one of the player's team arrays.
      Specified by:
      buy in interface Purchasable
      Parameters:
      player - PlayerTeam containing the money and arrays required for processing.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      toString override; returns Athlete's name.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      Athlete's name as a string.

    • genAthlete

      public static Athlete genAthlete(Random rand)
      Static method; randomly generates a new Athlete object from one of the three possible subclasses, with (relatively) equal likelihoods of each.
      Parameters:
      rand - Random number generator object.
      Returns:
      Either a newly-generated Attacker, Defender, or All-Rounder.

    • gen

      public String gen(Random rand)
      Static method; generates a randomized forename and surname for a new Athlete by combining choices from forenames.txt and surnames.txt. If the files cannot be read, the name defaults to "John Smith".
      Returns:
      String joining the selected forename and surname.

    • read

      public String read(String filename, int lines, Random rand) throws IOException
      Reads txt files as given by gen() and genTeam(), and returns a random line within the specified bound. If the file cannot be read, throws IOException.
      Parameters:
      filename - The name of the file to be read.
      lines - The upper bound of possible lines to read.
      Returns:
      String containing the contents of a random line as chosen based on the specified bound.
      Throws:
      IOException
